artist: Artist: Francisco José de Goya y Lucientes
creditline: The William Hood Dunwoody Fund, by exchange
medium: Etching, burnished aquatint, lavis, and drypoint
portfolio: From From Los Desastres de la Guerra (The Disasters of War), 1810–1820 (published 1863)
text: Two women are represented fighting for their lives in this scene from Goya’s "Disasters of War." One stabs a fallen soldier, the other is ferociously wrestled to the ground. Goya boldly employed a coarsely granulated aquatint on this plate, which sets the violent scene in a dystopian moonscape, a world obscured by an explosive pattern of tone and light.
title: Las mugeres dan valor (The Women Give Courage)
